oai_dc:dc.dc:description: MENTICULTURE USE ALL YOUR FACULTIES IF YOU WOULD BE HEALTHY, WEALTHY AND WISE. A SERIES OF PRACTICAL LECTURES ON THE CULTIVATION OF MIND AND BODY BY L. CROZIER FRENCH. This course is intended to teach thinking and to show the power of the individual for self development. It shows how the most menial service may be illuminated and become a most delightful occupation. Nature's highest laws studied by means of a review of the common duties in the home and in business affairs. No study required, no reading of books or momorizing (sic.) of formulas necessary to gain the power of analysis which enables one to know the mind, to learn to control, direct and quicken its action, so that it may be ready to act in every emergency. How the commonest avocations of life may be made means for obtaining the highest culture. THE THEORY SET FORTH IN FIVE INFORMAL LECTURES. PRACTICE GIVEN BY MEANS OF FIVE PRACTICAL LESSONS, ILLUSTRATED BY LITERARY RECITALS. TERMS. THE WHOLE SERIES, $5 00. EACH DIVISION, $3.00. TICKETS TRANSFERABLE. LECTURES. 1. Unity and Individuality. 2. Reading, Observation, Memory. 3. Conversation, Public Speaking-. 4. Character, Trinity in Nature. 5. Reserve Power in Mind. LESSONS 1. General Review of the Threefold Nature of Man—Mechanical, Intellectual, Emotional. 2. Mechanical Nature, Body, Health. 3. Intellectual Nature, Mind, Wisdom. 4. Emotional Nature, Soul, Wealth. 5. The Three Ls in Education.
